alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 10:43PM CDT until July 31 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT/115 AM CDT/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Nebraska and the panhandle, including the following counties, Cherry and Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT /115 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 PM MDT /1041 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Gordon, White Clay, Mount Maria, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Pine Ridge and Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
